questions.explanation: The stop sign is the only eight-sided sign you will see on any roadway. When you encounter a stop sign, you must come to a complete stop. You may not proceed until the way is clear for you to completely and safely pass through the intersection.

questions.question: A good defensive driver:
questions.answerB: Looks out for the actions of other drivers.
questions.answerC: Travels at a constant speed.
questions.explanation: Even the most experienced drivers can be distracted while driving. A defensive driver looks out for the actions of other drivers and anticipates potential problems.

questions.question: You are entering a crowded freeway. What should you do to merge into traffic?
questions.answerA: Use your side and rearview mirrors and check your blind spots.
questions.answerB: Use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to match the speed of freeway traffic.
questions.answerC: Yield to traffic already on the freeway.
questions.explanation: Use the entrance ramp to accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic and yield to traffic already using the freeway. Before entering traffic, use your mirrors and check your blind spots to verify that you have room to safely merge.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Crossroad ahead.
questions.answerC: No right turn.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. They should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid brake damage or collision.

questions.question: You notice a vehicle defect which may affect the safe operation of your vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Correct the defect as soon as possible.
questions.answerB: Correct the defect when you can afford it.
questions.answerC: Drive the vehicle at slower speeds.
questions.explanation: Any defect that may affect the safe operation of a vehicle should be corrected as soon as possible. Defects should be corrected before the vehicle is driven.

questions.question: This yellow sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a sharp turn to the right.
questions.answerB: The lane must turn right.
questions.answerC: A right turn is permitted on a green arrow only.
questions.explanation: Some warning signs have a fluorescent yellow-green background. These signs warn of upcoming conditions, including roads with curves and sharp turns.

questions.question: A speed restriction sign:
questions.answerA: May be ignored in rainy, snowy, or icy conditions.
questions.answerB: Has a triangular shape.
questions.answerC: Is blue with black lettering.
questions.answerD: Shows a recommended speed for a curve or turn.
questions.explanation: Curve and turn warning signs often have attached advisory speed signs that show a recommended driving speed for drivers in the curves and turns. Although a driver may feel comfortable driving at a higher speed in fair weather, they should never do so under rainy, snowy, or icy conditions.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection that is controlled by a flashing red traffic signal, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.
questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red traffic signal the same as you would treat a stop sign. Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals for you to stop, you should:
questions.answerB: Obey the traffic signal.
questions.answerC: Do what the vehicle in front of you does.
questions.explanation: Drivers must obey any instructions given by a police officer, even if the instructions contradict laws, signs, signals, or markings that would otherwise apply.

questions.question: Vehicles stopped behind a school bus with its red lights flashing must remain stopped until:
questions.answerA: All students are off the bus.
questions.answerB: The stop arm is retracted.
questions.answerC: The stop arm is retracted and the bus resumes motion.
questions.explanation: When a school bus is flashing its red lights and has its stop arm extended, motorists must come to a full stop until the lights are turned off, the stop arm is withdrawn, and the bus begins moving again.

questions.question: To prevent hydroplaning, you should:
questions.answerA: Ensure that your tires have good tread depth.
questions.answerB: Ensure that your tires are properly inflated.
questions.answerC: Reduce your speed when driving in the rain.
questions.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, you should ensure that the tires on your vehicle have good tread depth and are inflated to the proper pressure. Reduce the speed of your vehicle when driving in the rain. Hydroplaning occurs most frequently at higher speeds.

questions.question: Defensive driving is:
questions.answerA: Identifying dangerous driving situations and taking action to avoid accidents.
questions.answerB: Defending yourself against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
questions.answerC: Following the vehicle ahead of you at a close distance.
questions.answerD: Quickly changing lanes and shifting in and out of traffic congestion.
questions.explanation: You drive defensively when you identify dangerous driving situations and take action before an accident occurs. Defensive driving helps prevent conflicts with aggressive, offensive, discourteous, careless, inattentive, impulsive, ignorant, or intoxicated drivers or pedestrians.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop at the intersection.
questions.answerB: Maintain your normal speed.
questions.answerC: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A traffic signal displaying a flashing yellow light indicates that you should be alert and proceed with caution. Slow down when approaching a flashing yellow traffic signal.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Drive with caution and be ready to slow down.
questions.answerB: Do not drive in this lane.
questions.answerC: You must come to a complete stop and yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: Slow down, be prepared to stop, and, if necessary, yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: This type of triangular sign means drivers must yield. You must slow down as you come to an intersection marked with this sign and be prepared to stop. Let any other vehicles, bicyclists, or pedestrians pass safely before you proceed.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Jogging trail.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates the presence of a crosswalk, regardless of if it is marked on the pavement or not. Upon seeing this sign, you should be alert and allow any pedestrians to cross the road safely.

questions.question: This symbol is used for:
questions.answerB: Slow-moving vehicles.
questions.answerC: Yield signs.
questions.explanation: A reflective orange triangle on the rear of a vehicle means it travels only at slow speeds. You may see this sign on roadwork equipment, farm vehicles, or horse-drawn wagons and carriages. It appears as a solid orange triangle during the day and a hollow red triangle at night.

questions.question: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you:
questions.answerA: May still turn, but you must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: May no longer turn and must proceed straight.
questions.answerC: Still have the right-of-way to turn.
questions.answerD: No longer have to turn in the direction that the arrow indicated.
questions.explanation: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you may still turn in the direction that the arrow was pointing but you must first yield to pedestrians and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Certain highway signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Such signs are known as:
questions.answerB: Warning signs.
questions.answerC: Information signs.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Failure to comply is subject to penalty.

questions.question: Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
questions.answerB: At any time.
questions.answerC: After changing lanes.
questions.answerD: Early enough for others to know your plans.
questions.explanation: Before passing, you should signal early enough for other drivers to know your plans in advance.

questions.question: Headlights are required when visibility is less than:
questions.answerB: 300 feet.
questions.answerC: 500 feet.
questions.explanation: Iowa law requires drivers to use their headlights from sunset to sunrise. Headlights must also be used at any other time when visibility is limited to 500 feet or less.

questions.question: Any amount of alcohol in the blood may affect a driver's:
questions.answerB: Judgment and physical coordination.
questions.answerC: Knowledge.
questions.explanation: A driver’s ability to safely operate a vehicle may be impaired at any BAC level, even a level lower than the legal limit. Any amount of alcohol can affect one’s judgment and physical coordination. Driving under the influence of even a small amount of alcohol can lead to criminal charges.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection with a steady yellow traffic light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a safe stop.
questions.explanation: When a steady yellow light appears on a traffic signal, you should prepare to stop. If you are already within the intersection, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Side road.
questions.answerC: Railroad ahead.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are used to warn of actual or possible hazards. The color orange is used for warning signs usually found in construction or maintenance areas.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your low beam headlights:
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: You should always use your low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beam headlights may cause the light to reflect off of the fog and into your eyes.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle on a road with two lanes traveling in opposite directions, you should:
questions.answerA: Return to the driving lane when there's enough room between you and the vehicle you passed.
questions.answerB: Remain in the left lane if you intend to turn left.
questions.answerC: Return to the right side of the roadway immediately.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle on a two-lane roadway, you must return to the right side of the roadway when there is enough room between you and the vehicle you have passed.

questions.question: Drivers are always required to stop for a stopped school bus when driving on a two-lane road.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Drivers are always required to stop for a stopped school bus when driving on a two-lane road, regardless of their direction of travel. You should exercise caution when driving near children.

questions.question: Blood alcohol content (BAC) depends on each of the following, except:
questions.answerB: How much you drink.
questions.answerC: How much time passes between drinks.
questions.explanation: Your blood alcohol content (BAC) depends on how much alcohol you drink, how much time passes between drinks, and your weight. It is not affected by the type of alcoholic beverages you drink, your level of physical fitness, or how well you can "hold your liquor."

questions.question: Motorists should maintain a safe operating distance when driving near a cyclist.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: Drivers must be especially careful when driving near a cyclist and should maintain a safe operating distance between their vehicle and the cyclist.

questions.question: When changing lanes:
questions.answerA: Check your side mirror and look over your shoulder to make sure the lane is clear.
questions.answerB: Check the inside rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Slow down.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should check your side mirrors and look over your shoulder to make sure it is safe to proceed.

questions.question: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:
questions.answerA: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.
questions.answerB: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
questions.answerC: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.
questions.explanation: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

questions.question: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:
questions.answerA: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.
questions.answerB: If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.
questions.answerC: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

questions.question: Which is the correct sequence of events as a school bus driver prepares to stop to load or unload children?
questions.answerA: Amber lights flash at the top of the bus, the bus stops as red lights flash, a stop arm goes out, and the door opens for the school children.
questions.answerB: The bus driver activates red flashing lights at the top of the bus, then activates amber flashing lights when the children are unloaded or seated.
questions.answerC: A stop arm goes out, amber lights begin flashing, and the school bus stops to load or unload children.
questions.explanation: When you meet an oncoming school bus displaying flashing amber lights, you must slow to a speed no faster than 20 mph and be prepared to stop. If its red lights are flashing or if its stop arm is out, you must come to a complete stop at least 15 feet from the bus. Remain stopped as long as the red lights flash or the stop arm is out.

questions.question: Alcohol is:
questions.answerB: An antihistamine.
questions.answerC: A depressant.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant that dulls your judgment and makes your reflexes unreliable.

questions.question: You should always travel:
questions.answerA: At the speed of vehicles surrounding you.
questions.answerB: At the speed limit.
questions.answerC: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.
questions.explanation: The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

questions.question: Double solid yellow line markings down the center of a road indicate that passing is:
questions.answerB: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
questions.answerC: Not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A double yellow centerline means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the centerline to pass.

questions.question: When may you legally drive around or under a railroad crossing gate?
questions.answerB: When you can see clearly in both directions.
questions.answerC: When the warning lights are not flashing.
questions.explanation: Do not go around or under any lowered gate at a railroad crossing. Once the gate is raised, do not proceed across the tracks until you can see clearly in both directions and are sure there are no trains coming.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerB: Regulatory sign.
questions.answerC: Warning sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

questions.question: What is a potential effect of taking a prescription drug while drinking alcohol?
questions.answerA: There will likely be no effect.
questions.answerB: It will make you more alert.
questions.answerC: It can make you unfit to drive.
questions.explanation: Legal medications, both prescription and over-the-counter, can impair your ability to drive. They can be particularly dangerous when used in combination with alcohol.

questions.question: The consumption of alcohol while taking drugs can:
questions.answerA: Decrease the effects of the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerB: Increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerC: Help cure your illness.
questions.explanation: The combination of alcohol and drugs, in some cases, can increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol. It can be unsafe to drive after consuming either alcohol or drugs and is even more dangerous after combining them.

questions.question: What should you do when you are going to enter a roadway from a private road?
questions.answerA: Blow your horn to warn cars you are entering the roadway.
questions.answerB: Stop with part of your car on the roadway to alert other drivers.
questions.answerC: Drive out fast to merge smoothly with the traffic.
questions.answerD: Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and roadway traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering a roadway from a driveway or private road, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and traffic on the roadway.

questions.question: Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
questions.answerB: Reducing your speed.
questions.answerC: Turning on your windshield wipers.
questions.answerD: Looking for road edge markings to guide you.
questions.explanation: Reducing your speed should be your first response to decreased visibility and dangerous road conditions.

questions.question: A steady green traffic light at an intersection means:
questions.answerB: Adjust your mirrors.
questions.answerC: You may continue through the intersection at a safe and reasonable speed, if it is clear to do so.
questions.explanation: A steady green traffic light indicates that the driver may continue through the intersection. The driver should yield to traffic or pedestrians already in the intersection and proceed when the intersection is clear.

questions.question: You may continue carefully through an intersection with a yellow light if:
questions.answerA: There is an emergency vehicle crossing your lane.
questions.answerB: There are pedestrians crossing.
questions.answerC: You are turning right.
questions.answerD: You are already within the intersection when the light changes to yellow.
questions.explanation: If a steady yellow light appears when you are already within an intersection, you should continue through the intersection carefully.

questions.question: When approaching a traffic signal displaying a steady yellow arrow, drivers:
questions.answerA: Should merge into a lane in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerB: Should slow to a stop, if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: May turn left after yielding to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.answerD: Have the right-of-way and may expect oncoming traffic to stop for them.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow arrow indicates that a red arrow is about to appear. Stop unless you are already within the intersection.

questions.question: As your speed increases, it is important to:
questions.answerB: Look well ahead of your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Change lanes frequently.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases as your speed increases. When driving at high speeds, it is important to look well ahead of your vehicle to allow yourself space to safely react to hazardous situations.

questions.question: Another driver is trying to pass your car. You should:
questions.answerB: Signal to the other driver when it is safe for them to pass.
questions.answerC: Check for oncoming traffic and adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
questions.explanation: Keep right when another driver begins to pass you on the left. Check for oncoming traffic and adjust your speed to let the passing vehicle move back into the right lane as easily as possible.

questions.question: What should you do if your accelerator sticks while you are driving?
questions.answerA: Reach down and attempt to pull it up.
questions.answerB: Shift to park.
questions.answerC: Shift to neutral and apply steady pressure on the brake.
questions.explanation: If your accelerator sticks while you are driving, keep your eyes on the road. Quickly shift the vehicle into neutral and apply steady pressure on the brake pedal. Pull off the road when it is safe to do so and turn off the engine.

questions.question: When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
questions.answerA: You must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
questions.answerB: You have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
questions.answerC: Pedestrians must wait for you to cross.
questions.explanation: When facing a green light, you must yield to pedestrians and vehicles already in the intersection. Drivers must yield to pedestrians when turning on a steady green signal.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.answerB: Stop.
questions.answerC: Turn.
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: The sign with this shape and color is a ____ sign.
questions.answerB: Wrong way
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped warning signs like this are only used to indicate a no passing zone.

questions.question: A red traffic signal light means that you must:
questions.answerB: Stop before entering any crosswalk.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection.
questions.explanation: A red traffic light means that you must stop before entering the intersection. You must at any stop line and before entering any crosswalk.

questions.question: When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
questions.answerA: Signal your intentions ahead of the lane change.
questions.answerB: Check your blind spot.
questions.answerC: Make sure the lane is clear before entering.
questions.explanation: Always signal for an appropriate amount of time before making a lane change or exiting a freeway. Before you make any move to the right or left, quickly turn your head and look over your shoulder to see if your blind spot is clear.

questions.question: Before turning left, it is important to:
questions.answerB: Yield to oncoming vehicles.
questions.answerC: Swing to the right side of your lane.
questions.answerD: Wait until oncoming traffic has a red light.
questions.explanation: When turning left at a traffic signal, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop until the light turns green.
questions.answerB: Go through the intersection without stopping.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.explanation: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

questions.question: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:
questions.answerA: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.
questions.answerB: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.
questions.answerC: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.
questions.explanation: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

questions.question: When making a right turn on a green light, you must:
questions.answerB: Stop and look for nearby police cars.
questions.answerC: Yield to pedestrians.
questions.explanation: Unless a posted sign prohibits it, you may turn right or left at a steady green light. When turning, you must yield to other vehicles and pedestrians within the intersection.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in the right lane must slow down.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: Merge.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that there could be traffic merging from the right, so drivers should prepare to allow traffic to safely merge.

questions.question: On the freeway, you see a "Merging traffic“ sign. You should:
questions.answerB: Always remain at your present speed.
questions.answerC: Speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
questions.answerD: Move to another lane, if safe, to let traffic enter.
questions.explanation: When on a roadway with two or more lanes, you should make room for entering vehicles. If there is no one driving next to you, move over one lane.

questions.question: When entering a street from a driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Must drive slowly to allow approaching vehicles and pedestrians time to get out of your way.
questions.answerB: Must honk your horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians know to give you room.
questions.answerC: Must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
questions.answerD: Can disregard any pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
questions.explanation: Always stop before entering the roadway from a driveway and yield to any approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: If weather or light conditions require you to have your lights on while driving:
questions.answerB: Use your high beams.
questions.answerC: Use your low beams.
questions.explanation: Use your low beam headlights when driving in foggy, snowy, or rainy conditions. Light from high beam headlights will reflect back, causing glare and making it even more difficult to see ahead.

questions.question: To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
questions.answerA: Look into the left side mirror.
questions.answerB: Look into the right side mirror.
questions.answerC: Look into the rearview mirror.
questions.answerD: Look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
questions.explanation: To check your blind spot before changing lanes, you should look over your shoulder in the direction that you plan to move.

questions.question: Work zone signs mean:
questions.answerB: You must immediately stop and back up.
questions.answerC: Less than ideal conditions are present for driving.
questions.answerD: You should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
questions.explanation: Work zone signs are orange and indicate that some type of work is being performed on or alongside the roadway. Be extremely careful when you see these signs.

questions.question: When driving on an interstate, to avoid traffic merging from on-ramps to your right, the best thing to do is to:
questions.answerB: Slow down.
questions.answerC: Maintain your speed and position.
questions.explanation: When driving on an interstate highway, be aware of upcoming on-ramps. When traffic permits, move out of the right-hand lane to allow vehicles to enter from the on-ramps to your right.

questions.question: When driving in work zones, you should:
questions.answerA: Follow the driver in front of you closely.
questions.answerB: Pass the driver in front of you as soon as you can.
questions.answerC: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.
questions.explanation: When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

questions.question: Highways and roads freeze before ramps and bridges.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Ramps and bridges are suspended in the air, causing them to become icy very quickly in cold weather. Drive with extra caution when crossing a bridge in freezing temperatures.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to a four-way intersection controlled by stop signs:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Yield the right-of-way to the driver on your right at a four-way intersection if you both arrive to the intersection at the same time. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Two-way left turn.
questions.answerC: Minimum speed limit.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. Wherever this regulation sign is posted, U-turns are not permitted.

questions.question: In inclement weather, you should:
questions.answerB: Drive in a low gear.
questions.answerC: Steer and brake smoothly.
questions.explanation: When driving during unfavorable weather conditions, avoid slamming on the brakes and making sharp, quick turns. These behaviors will make controlling your vehicle in inclement weather even more difficult.

questions.question: You may drive around or under a gate that is being lowered or raised at a railroad crossing:
questions.answerA: As long as an approaching train is not too close.
questions.answerB: If your vehicle can do so without damaging the gate.
questions.answerC: If you first look carefully in both directions.
questions.explanation: Flashing red lights, lowered crossing gates, and/or bells at a railroad crossing mean that you must come to a complete stop. You must not go across the tracks until the lights and bells have stopped and the crossing gates are completely up. Do not drive around or under a gate that is moving up or down.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: End of construction zone.
questions.answerC: School crossing ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a flagger ahead controlling traffic in a construction area.

questions.question: Regulatory signs are:
questions.answerB: Yellow.
questions.answerC: White.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs inform drivers of specific laws that must be obeyed. Displayed laws may be about traffic direction, lane use, turning, speed, parking, or special situations. Regulatory signs are commonly white squares or rectangles with black, red, or green letters or symbols.

questions.question: You enter a designated turn lane to make a left turn at an upcoming intersection. There is oncoming traffic. You should:
questions.answerA: Move to the left of the center lane.
questions.answerB: Signal before you arrive at the intersection.
questions.answerC: Turn your front wheels to the left to be prepared to turn.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn, you should always begin signaling about 100 feet before the turn. You should keep your front wheels aiming straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. This ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle hits you from behind.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: The highway ahead curves only to the right.
questions.answerB: The highway ahead turns sharply to the right.
questions.answerC: The highway ahead curves to the right and then to the left.
questions.answerD: The highway ahead curves to the left and then to the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, you should return to your original lane when:
questions.answerA: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerB: You have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
questions.answerC: You are 50 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle, move back into your original lane only when you can see the passed vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror. This ensures that you will have enough room to safely pull back in front of the other vehicle.

questions.question: To see vehicles in your blind spots, you should check:
questions.answerB: The outside rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Over your shoulders.
questions.explanation: By definition, blind spots are areas that cannot be seen using your mirrors. To check your blind spots, you should look over your shoulders.

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
questions.answerA: Passing on the left is permitted from either direction.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid line.
questions.answerD: Passing is not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that passing is allowed from the lane on the side next to the broken line.

questions.question: Water on the road can cause a vehicle to hydroplane. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:
questions.answerB: 35 miles per hour.
questions.answerC: 40 miles per hour.
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning occurs when there is standing water on a roadway. At speeds up to 35 mph, most tires will channel water away from the tire. As your speed increases past 35 mph, tires cannot channel the water as well and your tires may start to lose contact with the road and ride over the water like a set of water skis.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement?
questions.answerB: Immediately pull all the way off of the road and get back on when it is safe.
questions.answerC: Accelerate and steer back on the road quickly.
questions.answerD: Take your foot off the accelerator, slow down, then ease back onto the road when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement, don't panic. Take your foot off the accelerator and steer parallel to the road. Slow down and ease back onto the roadway by keeping both hands on the steering wheel and steering into the road’s right lane with a small turn of the steering wheel. Check for traffic around you before steering back onto the pavement.

questions.question: Streets and highways are most slippery:
questions.answerA: When it has been raining hard for several hours.
questions.answerB: When they are clean and dry.
questions.answerC: Just after it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: Driving during the first half hour of rainfall is dangerous because roadways become extremely slippery when the water mixes with oil and other chemicals on the road surfaces that have not yet washed away. Use extra caution when driving on slippery roads.

questions.question: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:
questions.answerA: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
questions.answerC: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.
questions.explanation: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

questions.question: When used on roadways, bicycles are considered:
questions.answerB: Vehicles.
questions.answerC: Dangerous.
questions.explanation: Bicycles are considered vehicles when used on roadways. Bicyclists and motorists are expected to follow the same rules of the road.

questions.question: If a child is about to run into the street, you should:
questions.answerA: Start to prepare to slow down.
questions.answerB: Flash your headlights.
questions.answerC: Sound a sharp blast of your horn.
questions.explanation: If there is danger, you may need to sound a sharp blast on your horn. Do this when a child or any other pedestrian is about to enter into the street in front of your moving vehicle.

questions.question: To change lanes you should:
questions.answerA: Check your mirrors and signal, then change lanes.
questions.answerB: Signal, check your mirrors, check your blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
questions.answerC: Signal, check your mirrors, and change lanes.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should activate your turn signal in the appropriate direction and check your rearview and side mirrors. Look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move in order to check your blind spot and check the far lane to be sure no one else is trying to enter the same lane as you. Change lanes when you are sure it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Make room for cars that are entering the freeway by:
questions.answerB: Merging into a different lane.
questions.answerC: Maintaining your speed and position.
questions.explanation: Make room for vehicles that are entering a freeway. If possible, merge into the next lane to create a gap for the incoming vehicles. If you cannot merge, adjust your speed to allow for the vehicles to enter traffic as smoothly and safely as possible.

questions.question: If you find that the roadway ahead of you is flooded, you should:
questions.answerB: Not drive through the flooded area. Turn around and find another route.
questions.answerC: Drive only in the center of the roadway.
questions.explanation: Never attempt to drive on a flooded road. Even if the water looks shallow, it may hide many kinds of hazards. If you encounter a flooded area, turn around and seek another route to your destination.

questions.question: You may avoid the risks of alcohol-related crashes by:
questions.answerA: Deciding before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
questions.answerB: Simply saying, "No thanks, I'm driving," if someone offers you a drink.
questions.answerC: Calling a taxi.
questions.explanation: The only way to avoid the risks of drinking and driving is to decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive. Because alcohol affects your judgement, it will be harder for you to make safe decisions after you have started drinking.

questions.question: You are driving when it begins to rain. You should:
questions.answerB: Drive at the maximum posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: Slow down.
questions.answerD: Drive closely behind the vehicle in front of you.
questions.explanation: When heavy rain reduces visibility, reduce your speed. Turn on your headlights so other drivers can see your vehicle. If the rain is so heavy that you are unable to see clearly, drive onto the shoulder and stop until the rain lets up.

questions.question: You must stop at an intersection when you see a:
questions.answerB: Steady yellow light.
questions.answerC: Yellow arrow.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic signal has the same meaning as a stop sign. At an intersection with a flashing red light, you must come to a complete stop, look both ways, and proceed only after the intersection is clear.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Intersection ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign means that you are approaching an upcoming intersection. Watch carefully for cross traffic.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.
questions.answerB: Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

questions.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always:
questions.answerB: Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
questions.answerC: Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason.
questions.explanation: Any time you come to a place where people may cross or enter your path, or where one line of traffic meets another, you should look to the left and right sides of your vehicle to make sure no one is coming.

questions.question: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should consider each of the following, except for:
questions.answerB: Letting go of the steering wheel.
questions.answerC: Pressing your head firmly against the head restraint.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Press yourself against the back of your seat and put your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

questions.question: To help prevent crashes, you should:
questions.answerB: Ignore other drivers on the road.
questions.answerC: Drive only on side streets and back roads.
questions.explanation: Crashes often happen because one driver does something that other road users are not expecting. You should communicate with other motorists, bicyclists, and pedestrians by doing things like signaling when slowing down, stopping, or changing direction. Use your emergency signals or horn when appropriate.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerC: Curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:
questions.answerB: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.answerC: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

questions.question: Is it legal cross a double solid yellow centerline to pass?
questions.answerB: No.
questions.answerC: If there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: If the vehicle ahead of you is driving under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Two solid yellow lines down the center of a two-way road mean that neither lane of traffic may cross the lines, unless they are turning off of the roadway. A driver can cross double yellow lines when turning into or out of a driveway or entrance to a business. No passing is allowed over a solid yellow line.

questions.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
questions.answerB: A police officer
questions.answerC: A stop sign
questions.explanation: Directions given by traffic officers take precedence over signs, signals, and pavement markings. People authorized to direct traffic include police officers, fire police, highway work area flag persons, and school crossing persons.

questions.question: Double solid yellow lines painted down the middle of the road mean:
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerD: Passing is permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines in the center of the road mean that passing is not allowed from either direction. You may not cross the lines unless you are making a left turn or passing pedestrians, bicyclists, and riders of scooters or skateboards when the opposite lane is clear and you can pass safely.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Stop ahead.
questions.answerC: Roadwork or maintenance is present.
questions.explanation: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

questions.question: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: Drinking coffee after drinking alcohol:
questions.answerB: Cancels the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerC: Has no effect on blood alcohol concentration.
questions.explanation: Drinking coffee will not reduce your blood alcohol concentration (BAC). While it may help you to stay awake, it cannot change your BAC or make you sober.

questions.question: You are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction. Your headlights:
questions.answerA: Should be on their high beam setting.
questions.answerB: Should be on their low beam setting.
questions.answerC: Should be off. Use your parking lights.
questions.answerD: May be on either their high or low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Do not use your high beam headlights when approaching or following another vehicle at night. Switch to the low beam setting to ensure the safety of everyone on the road.

questions.question: This green arrow on a lane use control signal means:
questions.answerB: No traffic is allowed in this lane.
questions.answerC: You have the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: You must merge into this lane.
questions.explanation: A steady downward green arrow over a traffic lane means you may use the lane indicated.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.answerD: Be ready to help children crossing the street.
questions.explanation: You must always yield to pedestrians who are in or about to enter a crosswalk. Be alert to pedestrians when driving across intersections or turning.

questions.question: Never drive a vehicle through, around, or under any railroad gate or barrier.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Never drive through, around, or under gates or barriers at a railroad crossing. It is illegal and very dangerous.

questions.question: Because there is often slow-moving traffic on county highways, you should:
questions.answerA: Stay in the left lane and drive above the speed limit.
questions.answerB: Be ready to adjust your speed to the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Pass slow-moving vehicles when in a curve.
questions.explanation: By looking well ahead of your vehicle, you will be able to spot slow-moving vehicles early and will have time to change lanes or slow down safely upon approaching them. Always be ready to adjust your speed to the speed of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane reduction; the right lane ends soon.
questions.answerC: Highway entrance ramp ahead.
questions.answerD: Lane reduction; the left lane ends soon.
questions.explanation: This sign indicate that the right lane ends ahead.

questions.question: According to the Iowa Implied Consent Law:
questions.answerA: An arrested driver may be asked to submit to a chemical test to determine the alcohol content of their blood.
questions.answerB: Refusal to submit to chemical testing will result in a driver's driving privileges being withdrawn.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Under Iowa's Implied Consent Law, any peace officer may ask you to submit to a breath, urine, or blood test if the officer feels you may be driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs. This applies to both resident and non-resident drivers. If you take the test and fail, or you refuse to take the test, your license can be taken away on the spot.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerC: You may drive in the left lane.
questions.explanation: This is a "Keep right" sign. It indicates that a traffic island, median, or barrier is ahead and that drivers must keep to the right of it.

questions.question: Emergency vehicles:
questions.answerA: Have the right-of-way when using sirens, horns, and/or flashing lights.
questions.answerB: May use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
questions.answerC: May follow each other.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to police cars, fire engines, ambulances, or any other emergency vehicles using a siren or air horn and a red or blue flashing light. Follow any instructions given over the emergency vehicles' loudspeakers. Emergency vehicles often follow each other so you should proceed only when you are certain the way is clear.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: No U-turns.
questions.answerC: No exit.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.answerB: Curves right, then left.
questions.answerC: Curves right.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Tow-away zone.
questions.answerC: Steep downgrade.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be cautious when driving under conditions that may cause the roadway to become wet and slippery.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: A series of curves is ahead.
questions.answerC: An S-curve is ahead.
questions.answerD: The road will be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that especially slippery conditions exist when the road is wet.

questions.question: A steady red arrow displayed on a traffic light means:
questions.answerA: Drivers cannot turn in the indicated direction.
questions.answerB: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction after coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Drivers may turn in the indicated direction.
questions.explanation: If a traffic signal is displaying a steady red arrow, traffic in the indicated lane may not proceed in the direction shown by the arrow. Drivers must come to a full stop and wait for a green signal to proceed.

questions.question: A broken yellow centerline indicates that:
questions.answerB: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.answerC: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow centerline next to your side of the road indicates that traffic may cross the centerline to pass from your side of the road.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing, you should:
questions.answerB: Look for a train.
questions.answerC: Be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: When you see any signs indicating a nearby railroad crossing, you should slow down, look for a train, and be ready to stop. If the red warning lights are flashing or the gate is down, you must stop 15 to 50 feet before the railroad tracks. Do not try to go around the gate.

questions.question: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes?
questions.answerA: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.
questions.answerB: Getting adequate rest and staying alert.
questions.answerC: Scanning the environment and staying focused on the driving task.
questions.explanation: Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

questions.question: If you must park your vehicle in an area not usually used for parking:
questions.answerA: Park with your reverse lights on.
questions.answerB: Make sure your vehicle is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.
questions.answerC: Park five feet from the curb.
questions.explanation: Drivers are responsible for making sure their vehicles do not become hazards after they have been parked. Wherever you park, make sure your car is visible to drivers approaching from any direction.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane if you:
questions.answerA: Cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
questions.answerB: See the vehicle’s headlights in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
questions.explanation: Before returning to your original lane after passing, you must make sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. When you can see both of the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to the lane.

questions.question: It is legal to go faster than the speed limit when passing another vehicle.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: It is always unlawful to exceed the posted speed limit, even when passing another vehicle.

questions.question: Which statement about speed is true?
questions.answerA: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
questions.answerB: Speeding can kill.
questions.answerC: Speeding is not dangerous if you are a skilled driver.
questions.answerD: Both "Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous" and "Speeding can kill."
questions.explanation: As speed increases, the chance of a fatality increases. If you are moving faster than 80 miles per hour, you have almost no chance of living through a crash. Driving more slowly than other traffic can also be dangerous because other motorists may become impatient and make dangerous moves to pass you.

questions.question: Drivers may not pass a school bus when its red lights are flashing.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: When approaching a school bus that is using its flashing red lights, you must stop before you reach the bus and remain stopped until the flashing lights are turned off. On a two-way multilane roadway with a median or shared center lane, vehicles on the opposite side of the road from the school bus do not have to stop.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident and another person is injured. You should:
questions.answerA: Moved the injured away from the scene immediately.
questions.answerB: Always leave the injured where they are.
questions.answerC: Not move the injured unnecessarily. Keep the injured warm and administer first aid.
questions.explanation: After an accident, do not move the injured unnecessarily. Unskilled handling can make serious injuries out of minor ones. Keep the injured warm until skilled help arrives. If there is severe bleeding, attempt to stop the flow of blood with direct pressure.

questions.question: If you miss your exit on the freeway, you should not:
questions.answerA: Continue on the freeway and find an alternate route to your destination.
questions.answerB: Proceed to the next exit, leave the freeway, and return to your proper exit.
questions.answerC: Back up on the road or shoulder.
questions.explanation: If you miss your turn or exit, do not back up in the travel lane or on the shoulder. Continue to drive to the next exit or crossroad. Drivers do not expect a vehicle to be backing toward them on the roadway and doing so will likely cause a collision.

questions.question: A driver who is taking a non-prescription drug should:
questions.answerA: Read the labels on the drug before driving.
questions.answerB: Drink alcohol instead.
questions.answerC: Continue to drive regardless of any warning labels.
questions.explanation: Many over-the-counter medications can affect your ability to drive safely. If you take medication, even a remedy for colds or allergies that is not prescribed, check the label for warnings about its effects. If you are unsure, ask your doctor or pharmacist about driving while on the medication.

questions.question: Use your headlights on rainy, snowy, or foggy days:
questions.answerB: So others can see your vehicle.
questions.answerC: To warn others of bad weather conditions.
questions.explanation: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, it may be difficult for other drivers to see your vehicle. Under these conditions, headlights make your vehicle easier to see. If the weather requires you to turn on your windshield wipers, you must also turn on your low beam headlights.

questions.question: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

questions.question: A curb painted red means:
questions.answerB: The area is reserved for picking up or dropping off passengers.
questions.answerC: No parking, standing, or stopping.
questions.explanation: You may not stop, stand, or park at a red-painted curb.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Always insist on the right-of-way over a vehicle when using a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Never enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching.
questions.answerC: Enter a crosswalk at any time because it is the vehicle driver’s responsibility to stop.
questions.answerD: Use crosswalks only if they are convenient.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians should not enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching. Though pedestrians have the right-of-way in crosswalks, a vehicle approaching from a close distance may not have the time to stop before entering the crosswalk.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Watch for traffic merging from the right.
questions.answerB: Merge right.
questions.answerC: Turn left.
questions.explanation: Warning signs alert drivers to upcoming hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about potential traffic merging into their lane from the right.

questions.question: Regulatory signs:
questions.answerA: Are placed in every location where there is a present danger.
questions.answerB: Indicate what a driver must or must not do.
questions.answerC: Are diamond-shaped and yellow or green.
questions.answerD: May warn drivers that they are approaching a school zone.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs are often rectangular and white with black markings and are used to indicate what things a driver must or must not do in a designated area. They may display speed limits, prohibit passing or turning, or clarify any other driving regulation.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.answerB: Red, green, yellow.
questions.answerC: Green, red, yellow.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about the presence of traffic signals at an intersection ahead.

questions.question: To see objects in their blind spot when changing lanes, drivers should check:
questions.answerB: Over their left or right shoulder.
questions.answerC: Only the inside rearview mirror.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's blind spots are the areas that you cannot see in your mirrors. Look over the appropriate shoulder to check your blind spot when changing lanes.

questions.question: You must not drive your vehicle at a speed greater than:
questions.answerB: A speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent.
questions.answerC: A speed that is safe for existing conditions.
questions.explanation: You must not drive at a speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent. You must drive at a speed that is appropriate for the area where you are driving, the type and condition of surrounding traffic, the presence of pedestrians, the weather, the quality of the road, and light conditions. You must drive within legal speed limits.

questions.question: Interstate driving requires drivers to:
questions.answerA: Have the ability to safely drive at increased speeds.
questions.answerB: Be constantly alert.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Safe use of the interstate demands drivers be constantly alert and capable of driving at high speeds.

questions.question: Allowing a space cushion between your vehicle and its surroundings is important because it:
questions.answerB: Allows you time to react to unexpected situations.
questions.answerC: Keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
questions.explanation: The only way to be sure you will have enough time to react to mistakes made by other drivers is to leave plenty of space between you and the vehicles around you.

questions.question: If your car's suspension is bad, it can cause:
questions.answerB: Squealing brakes.
questions.answerC: Slack in the steering.
questions.explanation: Your suspension helps you control your vehicle and provides a comfortable ride over varying road surfaces. If your vehicle bounces a lot after driving over a bump, or is generally hard to control, you may need new suspension parts.

questions.question: Night driving presents unique problems because:
questions.answerA: The speed limit is increased at night.
questions.answerB: There are fewer cars on the roads at night.
questions.answerC: Distance and vehicle speed are difficult to judge in the dark.
questions.explanation: Night driving creates a unique set of problems for drivers. Due to the reduced visibility, it can be difficult to judge distance and the traveling speeds of other vehicles when driving at night. Drivers can see only as far as their headlights allow.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in right lane must slow down.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: Merge.
questions.answerD: Pass only in the right lane.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a merge ahead. It warns that two lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are about to become one.

questions.question: The posted speed limit shows:
questions.answerB: The exact speed at which you must travel to avoid a ticket.
questions.answerC: The maximum safe driving speed under ideal road and weather conditions.
questions.answerD: The maximum safe driving speed under all road conditions.
questions.explanation: A speed limit sign shows the maximum legal driving speed for the stretch of highway where it is posted. Driving safely may require you to travel more slowly than the posted limit. When conditions are less than ideal, drivers should slow down.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing yellow light, drivers should:
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Turn on their headlights.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light warns of a hazard. Slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
questions.answerB: Check your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check your side and rearview mirrors for traffic approaching you from behind. Just before you begin moving into the other lane, quickly glance over your shoulder and check for any vehicles that may be in your blind spot.

questions.question: You reach an intersection with stop signs on all four corners at the same time as the driver on your left. Who has the right-of-way?
questions.answerA: The driver on your left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: You have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Whoever is signaling to make a turn has the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that has stop signs on all corners, the vehicle to the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: At night, it is hardest to see:
questions.answerB: Pedestrians.
questions.answerC: Other motorists.
questions.explanation: Compared to signs and other roadside objects, pedestrians are hardest to see at night.

questions.question: Should you always drive more slowly than other traffic?
questions.answerA: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.
questions.answerB: Yes, it is a good defensive driving technique.
questions.answerC: Yes, it is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
questions.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection controlled by a flashing yellow light, you must:
questions.answerA: Wait for the green light before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
questions.answerC: Stop before crossing the intersection.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers must slow down, be more aware, and proceed with caution. Be alert to crossing traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: Because driving involves some risk, it is wise to continually improve your driving and observation skills.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: Driving can become unsafe if drivers believe they have nothing to improve. For your safety and the safety of others, always strive to improve your driving and observation skills.

questions.question: What may help drivers conserve gasoline?
questions.answerA: Sitting in their driveways with their cars running.
questions.answerB: Accelerating quickly.
questions.answerC: Slowing down gradually.
questions.explanation: Every time you have to stop quickly, it takes time and fuel to accelerate and get your vehicle back up to the speed of traffic. Drivers who look far ahead of their vehicles can slow down gradually or change lanes to avoid unnecessary braking, leading to better gas mileage.

questions.question: Before you enter an intersection, you should look to your:
questions.answerA: Left, your right, then your left again.
questions.answerB: Right.
questions.answerC: Left.
questions.explanation: Before you enter an intersection, look to both the left and right for approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. Look to your left a second time, as vehicle approaching from your left will be closer than those approaching from your right. Look across the intersection before you start to move to make sure the path is clear all the way through.

questions.question: If the gates at a railroad crossing are down and red lights are flashing, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and proceed only when the gates are raised and the lights have stopped flashing.
questions.answerB: Drive around the gates after stopping.
questions.answerC: Drive side by side with the train.
questions.explanation: Stop at a railroad crossing when the warning lights start to flash and the gate lowers. Remain stopped until the gate is raised and the lights stop flashing. Never drive around lowered gates at a railroad crossing because it is against the law and very dangerous.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Fire station.
questions.answerC: T intersection.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming traffic signal. They should be prepared to respond to a yellow light, red light, and/or cross traffic.

questions.question: The most important thing to remember about speed management and curves is that you must:
questions.answerA: Drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down at the sharpest part of the curve.
questions.answerB: Slow down before you enter the curve.
questions.answerC: Accelerate gently before you enter the curve.
questions.answerD: Drive at the posted speed limit before, throughout, and after the curve.
questions.explanation: The most important thing to remember about driving in curves is that your vehicle’s inertia may make it difficult to turn. To maintain control, it is essential that you slow down before entering the curve.
